intro: Hieracium obsistens, commonly known as the persistent hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and dense clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has basal leaves that are broadly lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grassy areas. Hieracium obsistens is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain regions.
